I think it’s fine. Don’t worry. It’s a good bet that the Japanese yen ğŸ’´ will continue falling so you may as well go on a trip to Osaka this summer. The sun has been dazzlingly bright there. You might just as well go for an outdoor onsen soaking up the sun (by the way I’ve just got out of an onsen and am drying myself on a towel)I enjoy going to the annual winter carnival ğŸ¡ and going on the thrill rides and eating pancakes ğŸ¥ and sushi ğŸ£ soaking up the nice Christmassy atmosphere. Several years ago I saw X japan live in Osaka Dome Stadium ğŸŸ which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. They’ve been strutting their stuff since they were young. Even though they’re past their prime they’re still excellent musicians so don’t sell them short ! At the end of the last encore, they bowed onstage soaking up the applause ğŸ‘ğŸ» They were given a thunderous standing ovation. The drummer took part in a three thousand metre race a few years ago where he came first. He rose to the challenge, ran for all he was worth and dived over the finish line ğŸ passing the runner ğŸƒğŸ»‍â™€ï¸ who was ahead of him earlier. Hundreds of people congratulated him on winning the race as he held the trophy ğŸ† up. The race was the opportunity for all the world’s best runners to strut their stuff. It was truly memorable. I work at Hotel JAP Osaka. My friend Alex received a commission for a sculpture from the hotel ğŸ¨ I congratulated him on having been commissioned to make a sculpture for the hotel because it’s a once in a lifetime opportunity. Another friend of mine who works for the hotel was assigned to the company’s branch in Hokkaido with which he is really pleased. I too am pleased about his promotion. Feel free to come to our hotel ğŸ¨ and say hi. ğŸ˜Š
